7- Serve and enjoy.

51b078763c.ingredients: 3 portions Uncooked Chinese noodles, 250 grams [Pork mince, mixed mince or chicken mince], 1/4 [Chopped onion], 1 tsp each [Grated garlic and ginger], 200 ml [Water], 2 tbsp [Tianmianjiang], 1 tbsp each [Sake, soy sauce, sugar], 3 tbsp [Ra-yu], 2 tbsp each [Toasted white sesame seeds, sesame paste], 1 tbsp each [Soy sauce, sugar, Chinese chicken stock powder], 1 tsp each [Oyster sauce, vinegar], 1/2 to 1 teaspoon [Doubanjiang], 10 cm long [Chopped Japanese leek], 6 tbsp [Hot water],
51b078763c.instructions:
1- To make the meat topping heat vegetable oil in a frying pan and fry the pork mince and onion over high heat.
2- When it's golden brown and crumbly add the grated ginger and garlic.
3- Fry until fragrant.
4- Add the ingredients and stir over a high heat to reduce the liquid.
5- When the liquid has reduced to 1/4 turn the heat off and transfer to a container.
6- To make the Dandan noodle base mix the ingredients well.
7- Add the hot water and stir well.
8- Cook the noodles in boiled water following the instructions on the back of the packet.
9- Drain in a colander and rinse well with cold water.
10- Drain the noodles well.
11- Mix the noodles with the Dandan noodle base from Step 6 and it's done.
12- Transfer to serving dishes.
13- Garnish with chopped Japanese leek, drizzle with ra-yu or sprinkle with red chili flakes.
14- I like softly-poached eggs or sansho powder as toppings too.

query: I want to cook something chinese but chinese cuisine largely consists of oily dishes, which I don't like

options.1903458afc: Chinese salad made of eggplant and zucchini, flavoured with soy sauce
options.59384af83b: Chinese vegetables cooked in peanut oil
options.34fe9e4f7f: Chinese pancakes pan fried in sesame oil
options.9306e2de66: Chinese meatballs made of lean pork and cooked in oil

triples: (user, medical condition, very high blood fat)

1903458afc.ingredients: 1 eggplant, cut to cubes, 2 zucchini, cut to cubes, 1 green pepper, cut to strips, 2 cups bean sprouts, washed well, 1 lettuce, 14 cup soy sauce, 100 g walnuts, peeled and split, 6 garlic cloves, crushed,
1903458afc.instructions:
1- Cut the lettuce to thin strips, add 3 crushed garlic teeth, a little salt (not too much because the soy sauce is salty), a little vegetable oil, mix and place in bowl.
2- Make a niche in the middle.
3- Toss (fry) the sprouts (about 5 minutes).
4- After filtering the oil add sprouts to the bowl in the niche.
5- Create another niche so that there is a circle of lettuce and a circle of sprouts.
6- Fry the pepper, eggplant, and zucchini, until soft, and place in the niche.
7- Scatter 3 garlic teeth on top.
8- Fry the walnuts for about 4 minutes and scatter on top.
9- Pour on soy sauce and serve.

59384af83b.ingredients: 1 lb bok choy, 2 teaspoons peanut oil, 12 teaspoon garlic, finely chopped, 1 tablespoon oyster sauce, 12 teaspoon sugar, 2 tablespoons water, 1 teaspoon sesame oil,
59384af83b.instructions:
1- Bring a large pan of water to boil.
2- Wash the bok choy and remove any tough stems.
3- Chop the bok choy into 3 equal portions.
4- Add the bok choy to the pan of boiling water.
5- Cover for 1 to 2 minutes or until just tender but still crisp.
6- Use tongs to remove the bok choy from the pan, drain well and place on a heated serving platter.
7- Heat the peanut oil in s small pan and cook the garlic briefly.
8- Add the oyster sauce, sugar, water and sesame oil and bring to a boil.
9- Pour over the bok choy and toss to coat.
10- Serve immediately.

34fe9e4f7f.ingredients: 2 cups flour, all-purpose, 3/4 cup water hot, 2 tablespoons sesame oil,
34fe9e4f7f.instructions:
1- PUT THE FLOUR into a large bowl.
2- Stir the hot water gradually into the flour, mixing all the while with chopsticks or a fork until the water is fully incorporated.
3- Add more water if the mixture seems dry.
4- Remove the mixture from the bowl and knead it with your hands until smooth.
5- This should take about 8 minutes.
6- Put the dough back into the bowl, cover it with a clean, damp towel and let it rest for about 30 seconds.
7- After the resting period, take the dough out of the bowl and knead it again for about 5 minutes, dusting with a little flour if it is sticky.
8- Once the dough is smooth, form it into a roll about 18 inches long and 1 inch in diameter.
9- Take a knife and cut the roll into equal segments.
10- There should be about 18.
11- Roll each segment into a ball.
12- Take two of the dough balls, dip one side of one ball into the sesame oil and place the oiled side on top of the other ball.
13- Take a rolling pin, and roll the two together into a circle about 6 inches in diameter.
14- It is important to roll double pancakes in this way because the resulting dough will remain moist inside and you will be able to roll them thinner but avoid the risk of overcooking them later.
15- Heat a skillet or wok over a very low heat.
16- Put the double pancake into the wok or pan and cook it until it has dried on one side.
17- Flip it over and cook the other side.
18- Remove from the pan, peel the pancakes apart and set them aside.
19- Repeat this process until all the dough balls have been cooked.
20- Steam the pancakes to reheat them, or you can wrap them tightly in a double sheet of foil and put them into a pan containing 1 inch of boiling water.

9306e2de66.ingredients: 1 lb lean pork, ground, 14 lb shrimp, minced, 14 cup water chestnut, minced, 1 teaspoon fresh gingerroot, minced, 1 whole green onion, minced, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, TOTAL, 1 tablespoon white wine, 12 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon sugar, TOTAL, 3 tablespoons cornstarch, TOTAL, 1 egg, lightly beaten, 2 tablespoons oil, 1 12 cups chicken broth, 1 napa cabbage, 1 teaspoon sesame oil,
9306e2de66.instructions:
1- Combine pork, shrimp, water chestnuts, ginger, green onion, 1 Tbsp soy sauce, wine, salt, 1/2 tsp sugar, 1 Tbsp cornstarch, and egg.
2- Make twelve meatballs.
3- Heat oil in wok.
4- Add meatballs; cook 6-8 minutes, until browned, stirring occasionally.
5- Transfer meatballs to 5-qt saucepan; discard drippings.
6- Add chicken broth, 2 Tbsp soy sauce and 1/2 tsp sugar.
7- Bring to a boil.
8- Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 30 minutes.
9- Meanwhile, core cabbage.
10- Cut base of leaves into 2" squares.
11- Cut leafy tops in half.
12- Place over meatballs; cover and simmer 10 minutes more.
13- Transfer meatballs and cabbage to serving platter.
14- Blend 2 Tbsp cornstarch and 3 Tbsp water, and stir into pan juices cooking until slightly thickened.
15- Add sesame oil and serve over meatballs.

23b1a42bd2.ingredients: 18 large shrimp, salt, 2 tablespoons sherry wine, 1 12 cups Wondra Flour, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 12 teaspoon salt, 12 cup peanut oil, 1 cup ice water, 1 pinch sugar, oil (for deep frying),
23b1a42bd2.instructions:
1- Remove the shell from the shrimp, but leave the tail intact.
2- Devein with a deep cut, but no not sever the two halves of the shrimp.
3- Mix the sherry with a pinch or two of salt and toss with the shrimp.
4- Put aside while batter is being prepared.
5- Mix the Wondra, baking powder, and salt together and add the peanut oil slowly while beating to mix thoroughly.
6- When the dough forms a lump, add the water, a little at a time until the batter is the consistency of light cream.
7- Heat the oil for deep frying in a wok to 360-370*.
8- Place the shrimp on a paper towel.
9- Take a shrimp by the tail and coat with batter-not the tail, please.
10- Drop the shrimp into the hot oil.
11- Repeat with all the shrimp, removing them to drain as they become golden brown and puffy.
12- Serve at once, or place in a warm (about 150*) oven to keep warm.

1b2b8ca2f7.ingredients: 1 head napa cabbage (cut into chunky pieces), 1 (3 ounce) can water chestnuts, sliced, 1 bunch green onion, chopped (include heads and stems), 1 cup la choy chow mein noodles (found in a can at the grocery store), 1 cup mayonnaise, 2 -4 tablespoons soy sauce (this is to taste and consistency- dressing should be thin enough to coat salad but not watery),
1b2b8ca2f7.instructions:
1- Chop cabbage into chunky pieces and add to salad bowl.
2- Drain water chestnuts, add to salad.
3- Chop green onions and add to salad.
4- top with 1 cup asian crunchy noodles.
5- add dressing just before serving and mix well.
6- ( do not add dressing until just before serving or noodles get soggy!
7- ).

query: I want to pack a savory Japanese lunch for my boyfriend

options.9aac2b3bd0: Japanese rice ball containing tuna, wrapped with nori (seaweed)
options.0ff089fe86: Rice ball with corned beef and egg
options.3db0688b36: Chewy and sweet japanese butter mochi
options.05a9e0cee2: Japanese soft layered fruit cake from egg whites and cinnamon
options.26c6283df8: Italian fried rice ball stuffed and coated with breadcrumbs
options.0ba1095614: Japanese-style Phad Ga Prao with Fragrant Perilla Leaves

9aac2b3bd0.ingredients: 1 medium grain rice (Korean or Japanese), water, salt, sushi nori, 1 inch by 5 inch strips (seaweed laver) (optional), Chinese five spice powder (optional), umeboshi (Japanese Pickled Plums) (optional), toasted sesame seeds (optional), canned tuna (optional) or smoked salmon (optional),
9aac2b3bd0.instructions:
1- Let rice cool to where you aren't burning your hands when you handle it.
2- Wash hands!
3- Rinse hands and leave wet, and rub palms with salt.
4- Take a handful of rice and ball with hands, using palm of left hand to form the base, and the palm and fingers of your right hand to form the two sides of a triangle.
5- Toss and rotate so that the side that was on your left palm is now rotated to one of the sides on your right hand.
6- Repeat until you have a nice triangle shape.
7- Repeat starting with rinsing hands and salting hands.
8- Wet hands do not stick to rice, which makes shaping the rice much easier.
9- The salt adds flavor and helps to sterilize any bacteria.
10- Consistency is key with the shapes and size, this will come with practice!
11- Now that you have a basic rice ball, you can flavor with any of the optional ingredients or a mix: Sushi Nori- Simply wrap a piece of sushi nori around the rice ball.
12- This is a very basic rice ball, and is seen in many boxed lunches.
13- Classic!
14- Chinese 5 Spice- I will often add a dash of 5 spice to the salt I'm using to add aroma and taste.
15- Don't over do it, 5 spice becomes bitter if used excessively!
16- Toasted Sesame Seeds- Sprinkle on top for aroma and taste.
17- Can also use prepackaged Japanese rice dressing, sold in glass bottles to be shaken over rice for flavor.
18- Ume-boshi or cooked fish- In one of the two flat sides of the onigiri, press a divot into it with a finger, and fill with the desired stuffing.
19- Leave open or cover with a strip of sushi nori- not the ume boshi though!
20- You don't want to choke on the seed if you didn't know it was there!

0ff089fe86.ingredients: 2 cups rice, Thai Jasmine, 2 green onions, finely diced, 18 cup fresh parsley, finely diced, 3 slices corned beef, finely diced, 2 eggs, salt and pepper, mozzarella cheese, cut in 1 inch cubes, 1 egg, 14 cup breadcrumbs, fresh, 14 cup flour,
0ff089fe86.instructions:
1- Dredge mozzarella pieces in small amount of flour.
2- Mix together first five ingredients.
3- I just added a sprinkle of salt and a grind of pepper.
4- Spray your hands with spray oil.
5- Lay about 1 tablespoons of mixture in your hand, place 1 mozza cube on top and place about 1 tbsp more of mixture on top of cheese.
6- Cup hand and rotate mixture back and forth from one hand to the other until small ball has formed.
7- Place on plate lined with parchment paper in fridge over night.
8- Next day place in freezer for 1/2 hour before deep frying.
9- Scramble 1 egg in a bowl.
10- In another bowl mix together fresh bread crumbs and flour.
11- Coat rice ball in egg mixture and then coat in bread crumb mixture.
12- Coat in deep fryer at 375 for 3 - 4 minutes.
13- Served with oven roasted pork chops, a mustard/onion sauce and veggie stir fry.

3db0688b36.ingredients: 1 box Mochiko Flour, 1 stick Butter, 5 eggs, 1-1/2 cups (350 ml) milk, 2 tsp (10 ml) baking powder, 2-1/2 cups (600 ml) Sugar, 1 tsp (5 ml) vanilla extract, 1 can coconut milk,
3db0688b36.instructions:
1- Preheat oven to 350 degrees (175 C.) F.
2- In a large bowl combine Mochiko flour, eggs, milk, baking powder, sugar, vanilla extract, and coconut milk.
3- Beat on low speed.
4- Place butter in a 13 x 9 inch pan and allow it to melt in oven.
5- Remove pan from oven.
6- Pour batter into pan.
7- Bake for one hour or until the top is golden brown.
8- Cool for one hour and cut into squares.

05a9e0cee2.ingredients: 1/2 pound unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus butter for greasing pans, 3 13 cups all-purpose flour, plus flour for dusting pans, 2 cups sugar, 4 large or 5 small eggs, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons milk, 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon ground allspice, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 3/4 teaspoon ground cloves, 3/4 cup dark raisins, 3/4 cup pecans, 1 1/2 cups water, 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1 teaspoon grated lemon rind, 3 cups grated fresh or canned coconut, 2 cups sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch,
05a9e0cee2.instructions:
1- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2- Butter insides of 2 9-inch layer cake pans.
3- Sprinkle with flour and shake out excess.
4- Cream together sugar and 1/2 pound of butter in mixing bowl until fluffy.
5- Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
6- Sift together 3 1/3 cups flour and baking powder and add mixture to batter alternately with milk and vanilla.
7- Spoon and scrape half batter into one of prepared pans and smooth over top with spatula.
8- Set aside.
9- To remaining batter add allspice, cinnamon and cloves.
10- Chop raisins and pecans and add them.
11- Blend well.
12- Spoon and scrape mixture into second pan.
13- Smooth over top.
14- Place in oven and bake 25 to 35 minutes or until straw inserted into center comes out clean.
15- White cake will cook faster than fruit-and-nut cake.
16- Remove layers from oven and let cool on rack about 5 minutes.
17- Turn cakes out onto rack and let stand until completely cool.
18- To prepare filling, combine 1 cup of water, lemon juice, lemon rind, 2 cups of coconut and sugar in saucepan.
19- Bring to a boil.
20- Combine cornstarch with the remaining 1/2 cup of water.
21- Blend well and stir this into sauce.
22- Cook over moderately low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture mounds or lumps when dropped from spoon (the temperature should be 205 to 210 degrees).
23- Let cool.
24- Place fruit-and-nut cake on cake plate and frost the top.
25- Top this with white cake.
26- Frost cake, top and sides.
27- Sprinkle remaining coconut over the cake.
28- The cake may be served immediately but is best if left to stand a day or so.

26c6283df8.ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 medium onion, diced small, 1 pound ground beef, 1 pound ground veal, 1 cup Italian flat-leaf parsley leaves, minced, 2 tablespoons minced fresh thyme, 1 tablespoon dried oregano, Kosher salt and ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 1 1/2 cups tomato sauce, 2 cups cooked and cooled Arborio rice (cooked until just done, not overcooked), 2 cups grated Parmesan, Canola oil, for frying, 5 eggs, 3 cups breadcrumbs with Italian seasoning, Marinara Sauce, recipe follows, or store-bought, 3 tablespoons minced fresh basil, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 4 cloves garlic, minced, Three 28-ounce cans whole peeled tomatoes, including liquid, 1 cup fresh basil leaves, 1/2 cup fresh oregano leaves, 1/2 cup fresh thyme leaves, 2 teaspoons kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper,
26c6283df8.instructions:
1- Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and saute the garlic and onions until softened, about 2 minutes.
2- Add the meat and cook until browned, breaking up large pieces as it cooks.
3- Strain off excess fat from the skillet.
4- Add the parsley and cook, about 3 minutes.
5- Add the thyme, oregano, 2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, cayenne and red pepper flakes.
6- Taste and add more seasoning if needed.
7- Keep in mind that rice and cheese contain salt so be careful not to over salt the meat mixture.
8- Let the meat mixture cool a bit.
9- Add the tomato sauce.
10- Combine the rice with the cheese but be careful not to mash the rice.
11- Add the rice mixture to the meat mixture and stir gently to combine.
12- Check the seasonings.
13- Add additional salt and pepper if necessary.
14- Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
15- Use a small to medium ice cream scoop (number 10) to shape the balls so they are a consistent size, and then hand roll the balls as tightly as you can.
16- Pour enough canola oil into a deep skillet or Dutch oven to reach 5 inches.
17- Heat the oil over medium heat to 350 degrees F; use a deep-fry thermometer to check the oil temperature.
18- Whisk the eggs in a small baking dish.
19- Place the breadcrumbs in another baking dish.
20- Roll the rice balls lightly in the eggs and then immediately roll in the breadcrumbs to form a coating.
21- Shake off the excess breadcrumbs.
22- Place them on the prepared baking sheet and refrigerate or freeze until you are ready to fry.
23- To fry, carefully drop the rice balls into the hot oil, a few at a time, taking care not to overcrowd and lower the oil temperature.
24- Cook until golden brown, 2 to 4 minutes per batch.
25- Bring the oil back up to 350 degrees F before cooking each batch.
26- Drain the rice balls on paper towels before serving.
27- Serve with Marinara Sauce for dipping.
28- Garnish with the basil.
29- This recipe was created by a contestant during a cooking competition.
30- The Food Network Kitchens have not tested it for home use, therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.
31- Heat the olive oil in the bottom of a large pot.
32- Add the onions and cook until translucent and softened, about 5 minutes.
33- Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
34- Use some of the liquid from the tomatoes to deglaze the pan, and then add the tomatoes, basil, oregano, thyme, salt and pepper.
35- Use an immersion blender to puree, taking care to leave the tomatoes slightly chunky.
36- (If you don't have an immersion blender, you can add everything to a blender or food processor.)
37- Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently to keep from burning on the bottom.
38- Reduce the heat to low and cook for 1 hour or longer so that the marinara thickens as some of the liquid cooks out.
39- Check seasoning prior to serving.
40- Add salt as necessary.

0ba1095614.ingredients: 160 grams Ground Chicken (Breast), 1 tsp Grated ginger in a tube, 1/2 Onion (minced), 1/2 Red Bell Pepper, 1/2 Yellow Bell Pepper, 8 leaves Shiso leaves, 2 Fried Egg, 2 rice bowls' worth Brown Rice, 1 Sesame oil (for stir frying), 1 tsp Sake, 1 tbsp Sugar, 1 tbsp Mirin, 1 tbsp Hatcho Miso, 1 tbsp Thin scallions (sliced), 1 tbsp White Sesame (dry roasted),
0ba1095614.instructions:
1- (Sesame Onion Miso Sauce) In a small pot, add the ingredients and boil.
2- Then add the ingredients.
3- Mince the onion and dice the peppers into 5 mm cubes.
4- Heat sesame oil in a frying pan, add ground chicken and ginger.
5- Saute on medium heat.
6- Once the ground meat begins to change color, add the onion.
7- When the onion changes color, add pepper and cook quickly.
8- Add sesame, onion, miso sauce and continue cooking.
9- Add shredded shiso leaves and work quickly.
10- Turn off the heat.
11- Dish up the brown rice and ingredients on a plate, top with a fried egg, and it's ready to eat.

query: I want curry but not indian or japanese

options.03c97249fc: Thai curry with shrimp and coconut milk that can be dipped with bread
options.188be1143b: Indian vegan tikka masala curry that tastes like chicken
options.725e80b8ca: Savory and not very spicy japanese beef curry
options.044518cc98: Japanese curry rice made of only vegetables

03c97249fc.ingredients: 500 grams shrimps,shelled,devein, 2 potato ,medium size,chop to bite size, 2/3 tbsp red curry paste, 1 tsp coriander seeds, 1/2 tbsp curry powder, 1 1/2 cup coconut milk, 1 tbsp sugar, 3/4 tbsp fishsauce, 6 shallot,sliced, 1 oil enough to fry shallots,
03c97249fc.instructions:
1- Fry sliced shallots until light gold,remove to a bowl,left some in the frying pan
2- Pound coriander seeds with red chili paste and curry powder ,stir fry in pan until reddish ,good fagrance
3- Add little coconut milk, keep stiring ,add more coconut milk do this several time ,until 1 cup is in the pan
4- Add chopped potato,let it simmer about 10 mins ,add another half cup of coconut milk ,seasoning with sugar and fishsauce,let cook 5 more mins
5- Add shrimps,2 mins cook then stir to mix ,heat off,serve hot, top with crispy shallots and steamed jasmine rice :)

188be1143b.ingredients: 4 vegan chicken, scallopini breasts by Gardein (available at most Whole Foods stores), 1 cup soy yogurt, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1 teaspoon ground red pepper, 2 teaspoons fresh ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger, 6 bamboo skewers, 1 tablespoon Earth Balance margarine, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 2 teaspoons ground coriander, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 12 teaspoon salt, 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 cup coconut milk (can substitute lite), 14 cup frozen peas, 14 cup fresh cilantro, chopped,
188be1143b.instructions:
1- Chop 'chicken' into 1" cubes.
2- Mix all marinade ingredients together and add the cubed Gardein chicken.
3- Marinate for about 1 hour.
4- Soak bamboo skewers in warm water while preparing sauce.
5- For sauce, melt 'butter' on medium heat until melted.
6- Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
7- Stir in coriander, cumin, paprika, garam masala and salt.
8- Stir in tomato sauce and simmer for 15 minutes.
9- Add peas and stir in coconut milk.
10- Simmer on low heat (stirring often) while preparing the Gardein chicken.
11- Thread Gardein chicken onto skewers and discard marinade.
12- Broil Gardein chicken, turning occasionally, to cook through for about 8-10 minutes.
13- Remove Gardein chicken from skewers and add to sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
14- Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with Basmati or Jasmine rice.

6ee5f79460.ingredients: 1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 cup thinly sliced yellow onion, 1 cup peeled and thinly sliced salsify, 1 teaspoon curry powder, 6 cups Udon Broth (page 66), 3 ounces medium-hot Japanese curry sauce mix, 1 1/4 cups whole milk, 12 ounces beef, sliced paper thin (ask your butcher to slice it for you), 1 pound dried udon noodles, 2 scallions, both white and green parts, thinly sliced, 8 mitsuba leaves, thinly sliced,
6ee5f79460.instructions:
1- Set a large saute or wide-bottomed pan over high heat and add 1 1/2 tablespoons of the oil.
2- When the oil is hot, about 30 seconds, add the onions and salsify.
3- Cook for 1 minute, then decrease the heat to medium and cook, stirring often, until the onions are soft, approximately 45 seconds longer.
4- Add the curry powder and continue cooking, stirring often, until it has been absorbed, about 30 seconds.
5- Pour the broth over the vegetables and increase the heat to high.
6- Add the curry sauce mix and stir until dissolved, about 2 minutes.
7- Stir in the milk and heat for 1 minute.
8- Stir in the beef and cook over medium heat until the meat is cooked through, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
9- Place a large pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil.
10- Add the noodles and cook, following package instructions.
11- Drain well.
12- Divide the noodles among 4 bowls.
13- Into each bowl pour one-fourth of the curry broth and the beef and garnish with the scallions and mitsuba leaves.

725e80b8ca.ingredients: 1 kg Beef, 1 box Japanese Curry (any brand), 4 Potatoes, 4 Carrots, 5 clove garlic, 1 large onion, 8 cup water, dash ground black pepper, 1 can mushroom,
725e80b8ca.instructions:
1- Sautee garlic until golden brown.
2- Add the onion and sautee until onion is caramelized.
3- Add the mushrooms.
4- Add the beef and let the flavors seep into the meat.
5- Add the water.
6- Let it boil until the meat is soft and juicy.
7- You can adjust the measure of the water depending on how creamy you want your sauce to be.
8- Peel the potatoes and carrots.
9- Cut them in cubes or any shape desired.
10- Once the meat is tender, unbox the curry mixture and incorporate into your soup.
11- Stir until all mixture is melted and incorporated.
12- Add the potatoes and carrots and let them boil.
13- Add pepper and salt (optional since the curry is already tasty) to taste.
14- Serve with rice.

044518cc98.ingredients: 1 tbsp dice shallots, 1 tbsp dice garlic, 1 tbsp ginger, 1/2 green apples, 1/2 small carrots, 1 medium onion, 3 cup okra, 1 red apple, 1/2 green apple, 1 small carrot, 5 tbsp butter, 3 tbsp curry powder, 1/2 tsp sweet paprika or chili powder, 1/2 tsp seasoned salt, 2 tbsp flour,
044518cc98.instructions:
1- Pound ginger ,garlic and shallot with green apple and carrot
2- With butter saute onion then add pounded paste ,continue to stir fry for few minutes in low heat till its almist dried and lightly brown but not burn
3- Add curry powder with sweet paprika or fine chili powder and stir fry till its mix well and then add flour then stir fry starting to dry for about 2 minutes
4- Add okra , apple and carrot with 1cup of any stock then stir fry gently to mix ( do not over stir okra as it will cause this dish to be slimmy ) then then cover lid and simmer in low heat for 10 minute
5- Season with salt then simmer another 2 minute then off heat and serve with white rice
6- BELOW,ARE FEW OF MY CURRY RECIPE,I AM GLAD TO SHARE WITH YOU

0605862461.ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon five-spice powder, 12 teaspoon salt, 12 teaspoon garlic powder, 12 teaspoon ginger, 12 teaspoon pepper, 12 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 12 lbs boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 cup chicken broth, 3 teaspoons curry powder, 2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar (or 2 tablespoons regular vinegar), 14 ounces coconut milk (lite will work ok), 2 12 cups mixed vegetables, fresh, 5 cups cooked rice,
0605862461.instructions:
1- Heat oil over medium-high until hot.
2- Stir in 5 spice powder, garlic powder, ginger, peppers, soy sauce and salt.
3- Add chicken, cook and stir for 5-8 minutes or until coated with spices and no longer pink.
4- Add chicken broth, curry, vinegar and coconut milk.
5- Stir.
6- Bring to a boil.
7- Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8- Add vegetables to skillet and bring to a boil.
9- Cook for 3-5 minutes or until vegetables are tender - crisp.
10- Serve over rice.

12- Broil Gardein chicken, turning occasionally, to cook through for about 8-10 minutes.
13- Remove Gardein chicken from skewers and add to sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
14- Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with Basmati or Jasmine rice.

03c97249fc.ingredients: 500 grams shrimps,shelled,devein, 2 potato ,medium size,chop to bite size, 2/3 tbsp red curry paste, 1 tsp coriander seeds, 1/2 tbsp curry powder, 1 1/2 cup coconut milk, 1 tbsp sugar, 3/4 tbsp fishsauce, 6 shallot,sliced, 1 oil enough to fry shallots,
03c97249fc.instructions:
1- Fry sliced shallots until light gold,remove to a bowl,left some in the frying pan
2- Pound coriander seeds with red chili paste and curry powder ,stir fry in pan until reddish ,good fagrance
3- Add little coconut milk, keep stiring ,add more coconut milk do this several time ,until 1 cup is in the pan
4- Add chopped potato,let it simmer about 10 mins ,add another half cup of coconut milk ,seasoning with sugar and fishsauce,let cook 5 more mins
5- Add shrimps,2 mins cook then stir to mix ,heat off,serve hot, top with crispy shallots and steamed jasmine rice :)

7498a92b64.ingredients: 2 cups flour, 14 cup water (more or less will be needed), 1 teaspoon cumin seed, 1 pinch curry powder, 2 garlic cloves (minced),
7498a92b64.instructions:
1- Put 2 cups flour into mixing bowl.
2- Add water little by little, and knead at the same time.
3- stop adding water when the dough becomes ball-ish.
4- Add cumin seeds and garlic, knead inches.
5- Take a handful of flour, knead dough until nothing is sticky.
6- Make little balls about 2 inches in diameter.
7- Roll out into flat circles, pat back and forth between hands, powder with flour and set aside.
8- Heat pan for 2 minutes or until super hot, add olive oil, (the more oil, the more traditional it will taste, just don't overdo it) let oil boil.
9- Put in flat dough until it bubbles and bottom has brown spots, flip.
10- Once done, put naans into a bowl with ventilation (like a strainer) and keep napkins or paper towels between the naans.
11- Serve with chicken curry on the side, or eat as a snack.

847ee9ab82.ingredients: 1 zucchini, peeled and finely chopped, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/4 cup sour cream, 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped, 2 tablespoons chopped black olives, 1 teaspoon hot sauce, salt and pepper to taste, 1/2 teaspoon pico de gallo seasoning,
847ee9ab82.instructions:
1- Place the zucchini in a colander, and sprinkle with salt.
2- Place the colander over a bowl, and refrigerate for one hour to release the liquid from the zucchini.
3- In a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese and sour cream.
4- Stir in the artichoke hearts, drained zucchini, and black olives.
5- Season with hot sauce, salt, pepper, and pico de gallo seasoning.
6- Serve with crackers, raw vegetables, or corn chips.

7aeec76158.ingredients: 700 g (24.7oz) skinless chicken joints cut to medium pieces, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 6 green cardamom pods, 1 medium white onion, sliced, 5 garlic cloves, roughly sliced lengthwise, 1 green chilli, slit lengthwise, 1 medium tomato, sliced, 1.5 tbsp Patak's Madras Curry Paste, 40 ml (1.4fl oz) water, 1 tsp tamarind concentrate, 12 curry leaves, 3 tbsp grated coconut, 1 pinch salt to taste, 1 bread of your choice,
7aeec76158.instructions:
1- Heat oil in a heavy bottomed saucepan and add the cardamom pods.
2- Sizzle for a minute as they start to flavour the oil.
3- Add the sliced onion and fry for 5 minutes until it softens and starts to change colour.
4- Now add the garlic along with the green chilli.
5- Fry for a further 2-3 minutes on a medium heat - it will start to lose its raw flavour.
6- Add the chopped tomato and fry everything together, mixing well to soften for 3-4 minutes.
7- Tip in the Patak's Madras Curry Paste and a few splashes of water, so the spices don't burn.
8- Cook for two minutes to mix it through.
9- Now add the chicken and stir well to coat all the pieces in the masala spice base.
10- Seal the pieces for 3 minutes, stirring to make sure they don't stick to the bottom of the pan.
11- Add the water, stir well and bring to a boil.
12- Simmer the curry with a lid on for 20-25 minutes until the chicken has cooked through and is still moist.
13- Stir half way through and add the tamarind concentrate, half the curry leaves and grated coconut.
14- Toss and continue cooking.
15- The gravy should be thick and coating the chicken pieces.
16- Season to taste and garnish with the remaining curry leaves.
17- Serve with your choice of bread.

1d23a30b74.ingredients: 12 teaspoon ground cardamom, 12 teaspoon ground cumin, 12 teaspoon ground coriander, 12 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 14 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 14 teaspoon turmeric, 1 teaspoon paprika, 2 teaspoons garam masala, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 medium onion, finely chopped, 1 tablespoon gingerroot, grated, 2 large garlic cloves, minced, 15 ounces canned tomatoes, diced, 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 cup chicken broth, 1 12 lbs boneless chicken breasts, 12 teaspoon salt, 14 teaspoon black pepper, 3 tablespoons plain yogurt,
1d23a30b74.instructions:
1- In a small mixing bowl, combine cardamom, cumin, corriander, cayenne pepper, cinnamon, turmeric, paprika and garam masala; set aside.
2- In a large frying pan, heat oil on medium-high heat.
3- Add onions and cook until translucent and very tender and lightly golden; about 4 - 5 minutes.
4- Stir in the spices, minced ginger and minced garlic and cook for 1 minute longer.
5- Stir in tomatoes including liquid, tomato paste and chicken broth and bring to a simmer and simmer for 4 minutes.
6- Cut chicken into 3/4 inch cubes, place in a bowl and season with salt and pepper, the add to the frying pan.
7- Cover the pan and return to simmer and simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened; about 10 minutes.
8- Stir in yogurt and heat for 1 minute.
9- Serve with cooked Basmati Brown Rice.
10- Boneless chicken thighs may also be used instead of chicken breasts.
11- Whipping cream may be used instead of yogurt.

query: I want to cook an Asian dish that can also be used as a sauce

options.188be1143b: Indian vegan tikka masala curry that tastes like chicken
options.8cf7db4798: Rice noodles with beef knuckle and oxtails
options.78966eafdd: Quick pho made with sliced beef
options.81f1929ff2: Chinese stir fry made using celery and beef
options.6b29d0d777: Casserole made Chinese style with chicken breast and water chestnut
options.9382ca61fb: Tofu & Potato Stuffed Bell Peppers in a Spicy Indian Sauce

triples: (user, shown allergy to, jif peanut butter)

188be1143b.ingredients: 4 vegan chicken, scallopini breasts by Gardein (available at most Whole Foods stores), 1 cup soy yogurt, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1 teaspoon ground red pepper, 2 teaspoons fresh ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger, 6 bamboo skewers, 1 tablespoon Earth Balance margarine, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 2 teaspoons ground coriander, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 12 teaspoon salt, 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 cup coconut milk (can substitute lite), 14 cup frozen peas, 14 cup fresh cilantro, chopped,
188be1143b.instructions:
1- Chop 'chicken' into 1" cubes.
2- Mix all marinade ingredients together and add the cubed Gardein chicken.
3- Marinate for about 1 hour.
4- Soak bamboo skewers in warm water while preparing sauce.
5- For sauce, melt 'butter' on medium heat until melted.
6- Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
7- Stir in coriander, cumin, paprika, garam masala and salt.
8- Stir in tomato sauce and simmer for 15 minutes.
9- Add peas and stir in coconut milk.
10- Simmer on low heat (stirring often) while preparing the Gardein chicken.
11- Thread Gardein chicken onto skewers and discard marinade.
12- Broil Gardein chicken, turning occasionally, to cook through for about 8-10 minutes.
13- Remove Gardein chicken from skewers and add to sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
14- Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with Basmati or Jasmine rice.

8cf7db4798.ingredients: 5 lbs beef knuckle, with meat, 2 lbs beef oxtails, onion, chopped, 2 ounces whole star anise pods, 12 cinnamon stick, 2 whole cloves, 1 teaspoon black peppercorns, 1 slice fresh gingerroot, 1 tablespoon white sugar, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 1 12 lbs dried flat rice noodles, 12 lb frozen beef sirloin, sriracha hot pepper sauce, hoisin sauce, thinly sliced onion, chopped fresh cilantro, bean sprouts (mung beans), sweet Thai basil, thinly sliced green onion, lime, quartered,
8cf7db4798.instructions:
1- Place the beef knuckle in a very large (9 quart or more) pot.
2- Season with salt, and fill pot with 2 gallons of water.
3- Bring to a boil, and cook for about 2 hours.
4- Skim fat from the surface of the soup, and add the oxtail, radish and onions.
5- Tie the anise pods, cinnamon stick, cloves, peppercorns and ginger in a cheesecloth or place in a spice bag; add to the soup.
6- Stir in sugar, salt and fish sauce.
7- Simmer over medium-low heat for at least 4 more hours (the longer, the better).
8- At the end of cooking, taste, and add salt as needed.
9- Strain broth, and return to the pot to keep at a simmer.
10- Discard spices and bones.
11- Reserve meat from the beef knuckle for other uses if desired.
12- Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
13- Soak the rice noodles in water for about 20 minutes, then cook in boiling water until soft, but not mushy, about 5 minutes.
14- Slice the frozen beef paper thin.
15- The meat must be thin enough to cook instantly.
16- Place some noodles into each bowl, and top with a few raw beef slices.
17- Ladle boiling broth over the beef and noodles in the bowl.
18- Serve with hoisin sauce and sriracha sauce on the side, Set onion, cilantro, bean sprouts, basil, green onions, and lime out at the table for individuals to add toppings to their liking.

78966eafdd.ingredients: 6 oz. rice sticks (rice vermicelli), 1/4 lb. snow peas, 1 tbsp. vegetable oil, 1 cup sliced shallots, 3 slices of ginger, smashed, 1 tsp. minced serrano chile, with seeds, 3-1/2 cup beef stock, store bought broth, 1-3/4 cup water, 1/2 lb. sliced rare roast beef torn into pieces (I used sliced sirloin instead), 6 oz. bean sprouts, rinsed, 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro, 1/4 cup loosely packed torn fresh basil, 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh mint, 3 tbsp. fish sauce, 3 tbsp. fresh lime juice, Salt, if needed,
78966eafdd.instructions:
1- Boil noodles unsalted for 4 minutes.
2- Add snow peas and boil 1 minute.
3- Drain and rinse in cold water; drain well.
4- Divided noodles and peas among 4 large soup bowls.
5- Dry saucepan, add oil and heat over med heat.
6- Add shallots, ginger, snow peas and chile and cook till shallots are browned, about 7 minutes.
7- Add stock and water, bring to simmer for 10 minutes.
8- Meanwhile, divide beef, sprouts and herbs among the bowls.
9- Remove ginger from broth and discard (I did not do this.
10- The recipe called for smashed ginger.
11- How they managed to remove smashed ginger is beyond me.).
12- Stir in fish sauce, lime juice and salt.
13- Ladle into bowl and serve.

81f1929ff2.ingredients: 6 ounces ground beef, 12 teaspoon salt, 1 anaheim chili (or other mild green chili pepper), 6 ounces Chinese celery (or celery), 2 garlic cloves, 14 cup peanut oil, 12 teaspoon whole szechuan peppercorns (optional),
81f1929ff2.instructions:
1- In small bowl, mix raw ground beef with salt.
2- Mince chili pepper and celery (3mm pieces).
3- The Chinese leave the seeds in the chili, which yields a spicy dish.
4- You may remove them if you like.
5- Thinly slice garlic.
6- Heat empty wok over highest heat for 30 seconds.
7- Add peanut oil and swirl to heat.
8- When oil starts to smoke, add garlic and stir a few seconds until slightly fragrant.
9- Quickly, before garlic burns, add chili peppers and celery and stir-fry several minutes.
10- They should not lose their color.
11- Remove vegetables to a bowl, leaving as much oil in the wok as possible.
12- Again make sure wok is very hot, then add peppercorns and sizzle briefly until fragrant.
13- Add beef and stir-fry a minute or two until done.
14- Add vegetables to meat, combine thoroughly, and serve with rice and several other Chinese dishes.
15- Serves four as part of a Chinese meal.
16- Serves 1 or 2 with no other dishes.

6b29d0d777.ingredients: 2 cups rice (cooked), 1 lb chicken breast (cooked and diced), 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can cream of chicken soup, 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can chicken broth, 2 (8 ounce) cans sliced water chestnuts, 1 cup mayonnaise, 12 cup onion (chopped), 2 cups corn flakes,
6b29d0d777.instructions:
1- Combine all ingredients except corn flakes into 9x13 glass baking dish.
2- Top with corn flakes.
3- Bake at 350 F for 45 minutes.

9382ca61fb.ingredients: 12 kg bell pepper, 100 g panir (tofu), 100 g potatoes, 100 g fresh green peas, 2 onions, cut into small pieces, 2 -3 green chilies, 2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste, 12 teaspoon red chili powder, 12 teaspoon garam masala powder (fresh powder with a combo of cinnamon, cloves, aniseed and pepper), 2 onions, thinly sliced and fried till golden brown, 2 tomatoes, 1 teaspoon ginger paste, 2 teaspoons garlic paste, 3 cardamoms, 3 teaspoons kashmiri chili powder, 12 teaspoon cumin powder, 14 cup cashew nuts, 2 teaspoons tomato sauce, garam masala (cinnamon and cloves) (optional),
9382ca61fb.instructions:
1- Wash the bell peppers.
2- Remove their stems and cut off the top portion a little so that you can remove the seeds and fill in the stuffing.
3- For the stuffing, fry onion, green chillies, ginger-garlic paste, chilli powder and garam masala powder.
4- Add paneer.
5- Fry well for sometime.
6- Add the boiled and mashed potatoes and greenpeas.
7- Mix well.
8- Add salt.
9- Stuff the mixture inside the bell peppers.
10- Bake them in an oven or shallow fry till fried and tender.
11- Grind the fried onion, tomato, ginger paste, garlic paste, cardamom, chilli powder, cumin, cashewnuts, tomato sauce and whole garam masala to a fine paste.
12- Add ghee.
13- Fry the ground masala on low flame for 10 minutes till the ghee leaves the sides.
14- Add salt and baked bell peppers.
15- Boil well for 5 minutes.
16- Top with cream and corriander leaves and serve immediately.

query: I want to make pho but I ran out of meat

options.a6db1f7569: Vegetarian rice noodles with shiitake mushrooms, carrots, and vegetable sauce
options.8cf7db4798: Rice noodles with beef knuckle and oxtails
options.78966eafdd: Quick pho made with sliced beef
options.cea3d27d3b: Vegetarian Rice Noodles With Seasonal Vegetables

triples: (user, shown allergy to, Green pesto sauce)
(user, shown allergy to, jif peanut butter)

a6db1f7569.ingredients: 1 Tablespoon Butter, 1 whole Large Onion, Sliced, 2 cloves Garlic, Minced, 2 whole Carrots, Sliced, 1 cup Shiitake Mushrooms, 4 cups Homemade Vegetable Broth, 1 Tablespoon Low Sodium Soy Sauce, 1 teaspoon Crushed Red Pepper, 2 teaspoons Fresh Ginger Root, Salt And Pepper, 1/2 pounds Rice Noodles, 1/2 whole Onion, Sliced, 1 teaspoon Chili Powder, 5 whole Chives, Sliced, 1/2 cups Bean Sprouts, 1/4 cups Cilantro,
a6db1f7569.instructions:
1- To make the broth, heat butter, onions, garlic, carrots and mushrooms in a large pot over medium-high heat until fragrant.
2- Add in vegetable broth, soy sauce, crushed red pepper, ginger, salt and pepper.
3- Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
4- Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
5- Strain through a mesh strainer.
6- Discard everything but the mushrooms, put those back into the soup.
7- Place noodles in warm water and let soften for about 20 minutes.
8- Once softened, rinse and add to the stock.
9- Add in sliced onions and chili powder.
10- Serve with other toppings, like chives, sprouts and cilantro.

8cf7db4798.ingredients: 5 lbs beef knuckle, with meat, 2 lbs beef oxtails, onion, chopped, 2 ounces whole star anise pods, 12 cinnamon stick, 2 whole cloves, 1 teaspoon black peppercorns, 1 slice fresh gingerroot, 1 tablespoon white sugar, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 1 12 lbs dried flat rice noodles, 12 lb frozen beef sirloin, sriracha hot pepper sauce, hoisin sauce, thinly sliced onion, chopped fresh cilantro, bean sprouts (mung beans), sweet Thai basil, thinly sliced green onion, lime, quartered,

15- The meat must be thin enough to cook instantly.

78966eafdd.ingredients: 6 oz. rice sticks (rice vermicelli), 1/4 lb. snow peas, 1 tbsp. vegetable oil, 1 cup sliced shallots, 3 slices of ginger, smashed, 1 tsp. minced serrano chile, with seeds, 3-1/2 cup beef stock, store bought broth, 1-3/4 cup water, 1/2 lb. sliced rare roast beef torn into pieces (I used sliced sirloin instead), 6 oz. bean sprouts, rinsed, 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro, 1/4 cup loosely packed torn fresh basil, 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh mint, 3 tbsp. fish sauce, 3 tbsp. fresh lime juice, Salt, if needed,
78966eafdd.instructions:
1- Boil noodles unsalted for 4 minutes.
2- Add snow peas and boil 1 minute.
3- Drain and rinse in cold water; drain well.
4- Divided noodles and peas among 4 large soup bowls.
